ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards]  Charming
ygData.msgSnippet: I m guessing you are referring to a Solo type situation.  When Charm is used in a group situation for crowd control you tend to want to stay with the group.
ygData.messageBody:
I'm guessing you are referring to a Solo type situation. When Charm is used
in a group situation for crowd control you tend to want to stay with the
group. This is especially true with fighting in crowded areas outside
Karnor's Castle in Dreads where you don't want to start attracting other
mobs and interfering with other groups.

Slyde
----- Original Message -----
From: "Jeffrey Sue" <jsue@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, May 31, 2000 12:57 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Charming


> if you are outside you should never get smacked when recharming, no matter
how
> many resists it takes. remember you can move and sing at the same time.
should
> just back off from the 2 things fighting with selos on. when charm
breaks, start running
> in a circle with the charm/charm/selo's sequence until charm retakes. if
you get adds
> then you have to run in a circle continuously but you should still never
get hit.
>
> At 11:35 AM 5/31/00 -0600, you wrote:
> >I've been weaving exclusively non-targeted songs while charming. Largo's
is
> >a good choice since it ensures your pet will likely beat an opponent mob
